org.intermine.biovalidator.validator.fasta.sequencevalidator

Class AbstractSequenceValidator

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.intermine.biovalidator.validator.fasta.sequencevalidator.AbstractSequenceValidator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SequenceValidator
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    GenericSequenceValidator, NucleicAcidSequenceValidator, NucleicAcidSequenceValidatorWithArray

    public abstract class AbstractSequenceValidator
extends java.lang.Object
implements SequenceValidator
    This class provides a skeletal implementation of SequenceValidator which other implementation can use the common features

      boolean isValid(java.lang.String seq)
      Test whether a sequence is valid or not
      int validate(java.lang.String sequence, long seqLineNo, ValidationResult validationResult)
      Generic implementation of validate() methods that iterate over each character of the string and checks whether a character is valid or not by calling isValid() method.

    • Method Detail

      • validate

        public int validate(@Nonnull
                    java.lang.String sequence,
                    long seqLineNo,
                    @Nonnull
                    ValidationResult validationResult)
        Generic implementation of validate() methods that iterate over each character of the string and checks whether a character is valid or not by calling isValid() method. [Note: implementation of this class can you this general validate() method by @overriding only isValid() method, that will be called for each character]
        Specified by:
        validate in interface SequenceValidator
        Parameters:
        sequence - sequence that is to be validated
        seqLineNo - line number of the sequence inside the source data, it can be used to reference the line number of the error while creating validation failure message
        validationResult - validation result where validation error can be added
        Returns:
        return boolean indicating failure or success

      • isValid

                       java.lang.String seq)
        Description copied from interface: SequenceValidator
        Test whether a sequence is valid or not
        Specified by:
        isValid in interface SequenceValidator
        Parameters:
        seq - sequence to be validated
        Returns:
        validation result
